llama2-70b_direct_sole-planning_results:
Day 1 (March 18th): Denver to Buffalo

* Fly from Denver to Buffalo Niagara International Airport (BUF)
* Take a taxi or Uber to your hotel in downtown Buffalo
* Check-in at the hotel and freshen up
* Have lunch at a nearby Mexican restaurant, such as Elmwood Tacos or La Taqueria
* Visit the Albright-Knox Art Gallery or explore the Buffalo Harbor State Park
* In the evening, have dinner at an Indian restaurant, such as The Spice House or Tandoori Nights

Day 2 (March 19th): Buffalo

* Take a self-driving tour of the city, visiting attractions such as the Buffalo Zoo, Canalside, and the Anchor Bar
* Stop for lunch at a local brewery or food truck
* Continue exploring the city, visiting museums such as the Buffalo & Erie County Naval and Military Park or the Buffalo History Museum
* In the evening, enjoy dinner at a waterfront restaurant, such as The Liberty Hound or The Waterfront Restaurant and Tavern

Day 3 (March 20th): Buffalo to New York City

* Drive from Buffalo to New York City (approximately 6 hours)
* Check-in at a hotel in Manhattan, such as the DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel New York Times Square West or the Holiday Inn Express New York City Times Square
* Have lunch at a nearby Indian restaurant, such as Tandoori Nights or Mint
* Spend the afternoon exploring Midtown Manhattan, visiting iconic landmarks such as Times Square, the Empire State Building, and Grand Central Terminal
* In the evening, have dinner at a Mexican restaurant, such as Los Tacos No. 1 or Empellon

Day 4 (March 21st): New York City

* Take a self-driving tour of Lower Manhattan, visiting attractions such as One World Trade Center, the 9/11 Memorial & Museum, and Battery Park
* Stop for lunch at a local eatery or food truck
* Continue exploring the city, visiting museums such as the National September 11 Memorial & Museum or the New York City Police Museum
* In the evening, enjoy dinner at a rooftop restaurant, such as 230 Fifth or The Top of the Strand

Day 5 (March 22nd): Departure from New York City

* Spend the morning shopping for souvenirs or visiting any last-minute attractions
* Check out of the hotel and drive back to Buffalo (approximately 6 hours)
* Fly back to Denver from Buffalo Niagara International Airport (BUF)

Budget Breakdown:

* Flights from Denver to Buffalo and Buffalo to New York City: $1,500
* Hotel stays in Buffalo and New York City: $2,000
* Transportation (car rental, gas, and parking): $1,000
* Food and dining expenses: $1,800
* Miscellaneous expenses (souvenirs, entrance fees, etc.): $1,000

Total estimated cost: $6,300

Note: The budget breakdown is an estimate and can vary depending on individual preferences and exchange rates.
